Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you confirm that the straps are tight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. But this [pulls at straight jacket] seems to be...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And now, the chains.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A lot of people think that magic camp is just for kids. And that's why so many other people in my class were kids. Self fulfilling prophecy. It's um, it's really for anybody with a dream and a belief in magic and a little extra time after school.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: MAGIC MAGIC Magic Magic magic magic... And now, Michael the Magic, will attempt to escape from extreme bondage. [Kevin giggles] Can he do it? I don't see how he can.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know how. Dislocate his shoulder and slip his arm out from underneath.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No. Everyone, now count down with me. THREE!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry, quick thing. Is it true that if you can't get out, you don't want anyone to help you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will get out. Oh yes, I will.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So we shouldn't help you, no matter how much you might beg and plead?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Alright, this is getting hot. So let's just do this. Ok, ready? Three, two, one, go. [Michael spits out key, Jim covers it with his foot.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: AHHHH!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Is everything ok, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I cannot tell you how I plan to escape. Other than by using magic. That is the magician's code. Separately, on an unrelated note, if you happen to find a small brass key...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [trumpet sounds]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ready? Come on guys. Early worm gets the worm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Another worm? Like, are they friends?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's early bird gets the worm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, would you smell my breath?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me smell. [Michael breathes at Dwight] Good, not great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "Michael, you go to parties all the time, why is tonight so special?" Well, tonight is so special because my boss's boss's boss, the CFO, not his initials, common mistake, is having a little shindig for all the managers in the company. And Jan and I are going as a couple. For the first time. So it's kind of our coming out party. Really. And that is why tonight is so special.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jimbo, last chance to carpool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no thanks, I think Karen and I will take my car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure? Might be a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Go in together, could save some gas, have some fun, long trip.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Play some games?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Um. I think we're good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I spy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why don't I wanna go? Didn't expect to need a reason, so let me think here. Um. I don't know any of these people. It's an obligation. I don't like talking paper in my free time, or in my work time. And, did I use the word pointless?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks for inviting me along.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, sure. Really didn't give it any thought. Wait, should you be going? [phone rings] Heh-woh you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Buttercup.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am on my way. I should be there in about 15...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Let's just blow this party off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Am I on speaker phone?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, yes you are.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Is anybody else in the...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hi, Dwight. Ok, Michael, take me off speaker phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No problem. [doesn't turn off speakerphone]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ok. Let's just go to a motel...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ...and just like rip into each other like we did on that black sand beach in Jamaica.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Jan. Jan? This party is actually a really big step for us. So, I...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Still on speaker?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ummm... I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Are camera's there?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: See you soon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Talk to you later, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael left early, so a bunch of us are going to go to Poor Richard's for happy hour. You should come.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I can't. My brother, he just unloaded the jet ski's and kinda took a bath, so... we're going to go get hammered.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, well, we're going to a bar. Hey. You have to come to stuff with me. I'm serious! If you're going to be my boyfriend, you have to do boyfriend things.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have decided that I'm going to be more honest. I'm going to tell people what I want. Directly. So, look out world, cause ol' Pammy is getting what she wants. And, don't call me Pammy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Beauty. Thank you sir!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Salad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You dressed exactly like the servants.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut up. Ok, change shirts with me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait. I don't think yours will fit me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't care. Oh, wow. Here. Don't put my jacket. Don't give me that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That would have been really embarrassing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Crisis averted.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, that duck is so cute.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oscar. Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Actually, it's polite to arrive early. And smart. Only really good friends show up early. Ergo de facto. Go to a party really early. Become a really good friend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, um, potato salad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's from both of us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: Wonderful, let's, ah, see where we can put this. Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you probably want to leave the cover on until the guests get here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's been sitting in my car all day. Sun beating down on the mayonnaise. Just, you never know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kevin, you and Stacy set a date yet?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, when is it?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's complicated. I would appreciate some space on this.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey. You made it.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You said it was important, so... How's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: What's up, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Kenny, sorry about the jet skis.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You guys, uh, want a round, on me?

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah? Get you a drink.

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: Thanks man.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No thank you, Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, you know that line on the top of the shrimp? That's feces.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you looking for? You bring dip?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm sure that it's catered. I need you to sign these, Michael. It's a waver of some of your rights. You should read it carefully. It releases the company in the event that our relationship, in your opinion or in reality, interferes with work. You get a copy, I get a copy, and a third copy goes to HR.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Awesome. I'm going to frame mine. I could frame yours too.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You realize this is a legal document that says you can't sue the company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Over our love.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I've never told you that I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't have to, Jan. This contract says it all.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I am taking a calculated risk. What's the upside? I overcome my nausea, fall deeply in love, babies, normalcy, no more self loathing. Downside? I, uh, date Michael Scott publicly and collapse in on myself like a dying star.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What's this over the "i"?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a heart.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Why is this so hard? That's what she said. Oh my God. What am I saying?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love this woman!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, no. Michael, please. Michael, please.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you ever watch Battlestar Galactica?

Quote.Speaker: Dan Gore
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No? Then you are an idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: Hello Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Rachel. Boy, you clean up good. Place looks great with all the lights on. And everything. Actually looks bigger with people in it. It's weird. So...

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Jan, glad you could make it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Of course, of course, David. Do you remember Michael Scott?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Of course I do.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: From the Scranton Branch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan and I are lovers. It feels so good to finally say that out loud.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: David, can I, um, speak to you privately for just a moment, please.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looks at beers] Oh. [Starts to walk away, turns around] No. Actually, one of these is supposed to be a lite.

Quote.Speaker: Bartender
Quote.Text: Oh, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: So did the merger go smoothly, or?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It did. Like butter. Mike Myers, SNL. You should ask Karen, she was one of them.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I'm the only one left. Everyone else was either fired or quit. And there is one in Anger Management.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, but you're great now, right? We're all great. Aren't we great?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We're good. [Michael tries to kiss Jan] Michael, stop. Please stop that, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: Can I get anyone anything, or?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I could go for an appeteaser.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Martini please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bagel bites or something.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Rachel, your house is beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's the square footage?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: About 5,000.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Does that include the garage?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, wow. That's not appropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm just...

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I don't know

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a common question.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David, how much did this house cost?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: These old colonials are great, when they're sound. I'd love to take a look around.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: I'll show you around.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cool, let's start with the banisters.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey, do you see that guy behind you in the blue blazer against the wall?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: That's Drake. And just so you know, I don't want to be weird or anything, but we use to date.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, ok. Cool. Thanks for telling me.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: And it didn't end well.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Gotcha. Alright.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: This was a gift from Lee Iacocca. Twenty year old, single malt scotch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here is to Mr. Iacocca and his failed experiment, the De Lorean. [takes sip, coughs violently]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You ok?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Do you have any ice?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How about some Splenda?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: One, two, three, up Jenkins! Down Jenkins. Oh, I think I heard the quarter over here.

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: On this side.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, it is definitely under one of these hands. [points to Meredith and Kelly's hands]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I think I heard it on Roy's side.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, it is here.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [tapping Meredith and Kelly's hands] Not here. Not here. Not here. Not here.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Good thing you didn't listen to me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, close one.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [points at one of Stanley's hands and one of Pam's] Not here. Not here. It's either here or here. [Stares at Pam] Not here. [Points at Stanley's hand].

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: YES!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nice job.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I can read you like a book.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You can't keep anything from me.

Quote.Speaker: Student 1
Quote.Text: Hey Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey! What are you guys doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Student 2
Quote.Text: You're the man buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I run a small fake ID company from my car with a laminating machine I swiped from the sheriff's station.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Huh. [Bangs on wall] Yeah, these studs are way too far apart. What's in here? [Opens door].

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: Uh, that's a guest room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just the one window?

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: [phone rings] Oh. I must get that. You'll have to excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are those real pearls?

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: Uh, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [tests smoke detector] Good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, it was nice meeting you guys. Take care.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Well, if you're wondering why his wife was staring daggers at me, it's because I kinda saw him for a little bit while they were separated.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Hadn't noticed.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Really? I thought it was so obvious. I'm glad it didn't make you uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it was before I knew you so, its fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This one really smells like vanilla. Check that out.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It's nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You and the misses should join us at Sandals Jamaica next Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I, Michael, I think David probably wants to spend Christmas here with his family.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, they don't allow kids at Sandals. They are persona non gratis... there. But it's fun. It's an awesome place. You would not believe how low this girl can limbo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. You're just going to have to excuse us for just a couple minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok. Excuse me. What's going on? What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Sorry. Michael, come here. Just, just, just, just. [kisses Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Don't you know what I'm doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, but you could tell me. What... What is that? Why are you? Why are we going in the bathroom? I thought this is where you liked your privacy.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What has gotten into you?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, let's go back to the party.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Just let me loosen my dress.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't take that dress. Stop it, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, means please don't. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Slam me up against the wall, right here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not going to slam you up against the wall.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're acting inappropriate. Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm acting inappropriate? Get out.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Here. [hands Pam a duck stuffed animal]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, where have you been all night? I was looking forward to hanging out with you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I was...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, don't you have a daughter?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [takes duck back] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh good, you're up. Hey, who makes this chair?

Quote.Speaker: Child
Quote.Text: I don't know, it was here when I was born.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I want one. It's got good solid construction. Comfortable. What is this? Oak?

Quote.Speaker: Child
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you know?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: God, I hate these parties. Do you want to sneak out back and shoot some hoops? Meet me outside in two minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You stay here and have fun, because I'm going to go out back and shoot hoops with David Wallace.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Ok. Oh, um, don't mention that you and I are dating cause I think he might still have feelings for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wallace? What the hell, have you dated like every guy here? [Karen smiles and gives herself away] Wow. Ok. You got me.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I so got you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, none of them?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Of course not. I mean, you're kind of like, my first.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh my God, it's so easy. Fun.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Not too good.

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: Did you get a chance to try Michael's homemade potato salad?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Rachel thinks that I brought homemade potato salad and I just picked it up at the supermarket. It's funny. I wish I could make potato salad that good. It's just potatoes and mayonnaise. There is something wrong with Jan.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: What's ah, what's with Jan and Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. Where to begin? My ball.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The chimney is in decent shape. Not great. I found some termite damage in a crawl space and some structural flaws in the foundation so all in all, it was a pretty fun cocktail party.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I want us to make it. I want a fresh start.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: That's awesome. That's what I want.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh ok, but in order for us to make it, there can't be any secrets between us.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I didn't do anything. Ask anyone, I totally could have and I didn't at all.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just listen. Remember that casino night about a month before we were supposed to get married? I kissed Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He told me how he felt and I guess I had feelings too, and we kissed.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Jim came on to you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just listen.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No, I am listening! That's the problem I am listening!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't yell!

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Don't yell?!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is over.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Yeah, you're right. This is so over. You kidding me, Pam!? Come on! God!

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: Damn jet skis!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Our first fight. If this is about what happened in the bathroom, there was no place to cuddle...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I feel sick.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You didn't have any of the potato salad did you?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, we were good when we were just running around, you know, in secret. It was wrong and it was exciting. Maybe it was a mistake to take it public.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, if that's the way you feel, my lady, then you have hurt me greatly.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Please don't cry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not going to cry. I feel like it but I am not going to. Why don't you just take your stupid love contract and tear it up into a million little pieces.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It was never a love contract, Michael and besides, I have already given a copy to David and it would be just as embarrassing to get it back as I was handing it to him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want the house, Jan. I want the picket fence. I want the ketchup fights and the tickling, and the giggling.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I didn't mean it. I was...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whatever.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Tired. I'm tired. And I didn't eat enough. And, and, that's all. That was it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's all, you didn't mean it?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: That's all. I didn't mean it. That's all. I'm just saying I didn't mean it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love you, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't break up you guys, you're great together.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Are they going to call the cops?

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: No, I paid them off.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Jet ski money?

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: All of it.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I'm gonna kill Jim Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I think it's great that Jim's invited. It's important to have contact with the New York execs, or they'll think everyone here is like Mi...chael.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: [Points to Pam's painting of the building] [laughs] You gotta sign that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No you gotta put your name in the corner. I've seen that artist do that. Its good too, cause like you can know who paints what, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, are you going to Poor Richard's?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't know, you?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I'm going and so are both of you. We're all going.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, isn't there some rule against inter-office dating?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [whispering] I am not doing your dirty work for you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I hear whispering.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, so promise that you'll wait till we leave the parking lot before you go to the bar.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes boss.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: See ya Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oscar, Angela? I didn't think you guys would come.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why wouldn't we come?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Because of reasons...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are there carbs in vodka?

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: Hey folks, what can I get you? Oh, hey Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: Another vodka?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah. Jack, these are my co-workers.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Sup?

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: [pointing to each correct person] Ryan, Pam, Stanley, Kelly, Kevin, Creed. How'd I do?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hmm, come here much?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: These wings are all fat and bone.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This place is disgusting. [They smile at each other]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Why would the architect design stairs this wide? Was there an obese family in here before you?

Quote.Speaker: Rachel
Quote.Text: I don't know that. I'm sure the architect passed away many years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How convenient.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I am attracted to weird, wrong men. I dated a violent karate instructor and then an unemployed fireman. Life has been complicated. I've made some decisions that I'm not proud of; my marriage, being overly litigious with my family. I orgasm fairly easily. Michael was kind of like my dirty secret, you know, having sex with him, oh I was just turned on by my own degradation. Um, why, anyway, I was told by somebody recently that I respect that I'm old enough to have a mature relationship, and that's what this whole evening is about and I have high hopes.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: [at the door] Hi Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: How are you doing? I've, I've missed you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I've missed you too...

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Don't you remember me?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um, you ah, you gotta give me a hint. Um, did you meet me at the gym?

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [still at the table] Who the hell is Ryan talking to?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [at the door] Are you a client of Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [at the table] Oh, not again. Melissa!

Quote.Speaker: Melissa
Quote.Text: Daddy.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Wait for my outside. [To Ryan] She is sixteen years old. What is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. Stanley, let me explain to you what happened.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: She came right up to me just like she did when you brought her into work.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No, no, no. You planned this whole thing boy. I'll snatch your spine out your back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Space shuttle. Which one? Oh, Atlantis. Good thing it's not the Discovery. You play soccer?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What a weird day. I don't understand it, but you don't get to understand everyday of your life. Maybe five, ten days a year, I'll get home and I will have no idea what the hell just happened. Guess everybody has days like that. Sometimes they're the nicest ones. Still, I think there might be something wrong with Jan.
